page.title: 11SHEFFIELD INDUSTRY
page.content: The Sheffield steel industry produces only a fraction of the steel it once did.One surviving factory of steel is {W.Tyzack and Sons}who,since 1812,have manufactured saws and scythe blades. Like many 19th century buildings,the factory is situated next to a river the River Sheaf,from which Sheffield takes its name.In the process,the metal expands with heating and is then beaten into shape. Much of the work done uses modern machinery and new technology but the scythe blades are still finished off by hand.
